p: We describe here the first MVD outbreak reported in Eastern Uganda [ 8]. Previous MVD outbreaks in Uganda have been linked to Kitaka and Python caves in Western Uganda [ 4, 11, 12], and one MVD outbreak, detected in Central Uganda, which involved a single case in 2014 [ 9]. The four cases of this outbreak in Kween district, which involved one cluster of closely-related family members and did not spread to other districts within or outside Uganda. This could be attributed to enhanced capacity of the Uganda National VHF and other MOH surveillance structures and their capability to quickly identify, detect and respond to filovirus outbreaks as has been described previously [ 23, 24].
